intro: Scabiosa georgica, commonly known as Georgian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Scabiosa georgica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate blooms.
